intro: Crucianella bucharica, commonly known as the Caucasian sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Leguminosae. It is a small, woody shrub that typically grows in coastal and saline environments. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of the Middle East. Due to its salt tolerance, it is sometimes used in coastal landscaping and erosion control.
